_comment: Created by ianb on 22/08/2014 12:40:38 using v2.1
title: How have rates of pressure ulcers in the community changed?
analysis_commentary: Incidence of pressure ulcers in community settings decreased from 8.8% of sampled patients in April 2012 to 5.3% of patients in March 2014. Incidence of type 2,3 or 4 pressure ulcers are higher in community settings, with an average of 6.3% of all sampled patients having an ulcer recorded in the time period, compared to 4.7% in acute.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Safety Thermometer
